It is a deciduous tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its hard, thick-shelled acorns, which are enclosed in a persistent cupule. Its leaves are usually革质 (leathery) and elliptical in shape, with a smooth upper surface and a hairy underside. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
